content.question: The circle has a diameter of 4 units. A diameter of the circle is from the origin to (r comma theta) equals (4 comma 5 pi over 3). Counterclockwise from the origin, the circle goes down to the left into quadrant 3, then down to the right, crossing into quadrant 4. The circle continues down to the right then begins up to the right, passing through (r comma theta) equals (4 comma 5 pi over 3). The circle continues up to the right then up to the left, crossing into quadrant 1 at about (r comma theta) equals (2 comma 0). The circle continues up to the left then finishes down to the left back to the origin. ​The graph of the polar function <math alttext="r equals g open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> , where <math alttext="g open parentheses theta close parentheses equals 4 cos open parentheses theta plus pi over 3 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> , is given in the polar coordinate system. Which of the following descriptions is true?

choices.label: Values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for <math alttext="pi over 2 less than theta less than pi"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> correspond to the portion of the graph of <math alttext="r equals g open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in Quadrant I.

Values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for <math alttext="pi over 2 less than theta less than pi"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> correspond to the portion of the graph of <math alttext="r equals g open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in Quadrant II.

Values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for <math alttext="pi over 2 less than theta less than pi"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> correspond to the portion of the graph of <math alttext="r equals g open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in Quadrant III.

Values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for <math alttext="pi over 2 less than theta less than pi"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> correspond to the portion of the graph of <math alttext="r equals g open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in Quadrant IV.

content.answer: Values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for <math alttext="pi over 2 less than theta less than pi"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> correspond to the portion of the graph of <math alttext="r equals g open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in Quadrant IV.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
